poem:
Tariffs on Steel and Aluminum  

Red buses groan  
under weight and heat,  
across bridged towns—  
rust whispers in the wind.  
Each rivet pounds  
a rhythm of echoing clangs;  
iron-veined pulse,  
fingers grip their ghost—  
this cost,  
this cold resolve.  

America,  
hefting the hammer.  
  
Silent trades  
along veins of earth.
